info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 13 at 3:35AM HST until November 14 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY FOR PORTIONS OF MAUI AND HAWAII COUNTIES THROUGH 6 AM TUESDAY... .Strong high pressure building north of the islands will bring strong and gusty trade winds over the next couple of days. Northeast trade winds are expected to become especially gusty as a cold front moves through the island chain tonight. This Advisory may need to be expanded to include additional areas and may also need to be extended through Tuesday. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Easterly trade winds 15 to 30 mph with localized gusts over 50 mph. Winds will shift to the northeast Monday night. * WHERE...Portions of Kahoolawe, Lanai, Maui, Molokai and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, and can knock down holiday decorations and tree branches. Strong gusts can make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
